intro: Schidorhynchos distans, commonly known as the distant horned plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, elongated leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Schidorhynchos distans is often found in wetland habitats and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
